text: Chiang Ching-kuo (27 April 1910Many sources, even Taiwanese official ones, give 18 March 1910 as his birthday, but this actually refers to the traditional Chinese lunar calendar â€“ 13 January 1988) was a Taiwanese politician. He held numerous posts in the government of the Republic of China (ROC). Chiang Ching-kuo was the son of Chiang Kai-shek. He succeeded his father to serve as Premier of the Republic of China. He was the President of the Republic of China from 1978 until his death in 1988. ==References== Category:1910 births Category:1988 deaths Category:Anti-communists Category:Methodists Category:Prime ministers Category:Presidents of the Republic of China
title: Chiang Ching-kuo
